member.summary: Find elements that match the query, with this element as the starting context. Matched elements may include this element, or any of its children.
member.param: a Selector CSS-like query

This method is generally more powerful to use than the DOM-type {@code getElementBy*} methods, because multiple filters can be combined, e.g.:
  • el.select("a[href]") - finds links a tags with href attributes)
  • el.select("a[href*=example.com]") - finds links pointing to example.com (loosely)

member.name: T:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Cleaner
member.summary: The whitelist based HTML cleaner. Use to ensure that end-user provided HTML contains only the elements and attributes that you are expecting; no junk, and no cross-site scripting attacks!
member.remarks: The HTML cleaner parses the input as HTML and then runs it through a white-list, so the output HTML can only contain HTML that is allowed by the whitelist. It is assumed that the input HTML is a body fragment; the clean methods only pull from the source's body, and the canned white-lists only allow body contained tags. Rather than interacting directly with a Cleaner object, generally see the Clean methods in .

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Cleaner.#ctor(JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist)
member.summary: Create a new cleaner, that sanitizes documents using the supplied whitelist.
member.param: white-list to clean with

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Cleaner.Clean(JetyDu.HttpParse.Nodes.Document)
member.summary: Creates a new, clean document, from the original dirty document, containing only elements allowed by the whitelist. The original document is not modified. Only elements from the dirt document's body are used.
member.param: Untrusted base document to clean.

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Cleaner.IsValid(JetyDu.HttpParse.Nodes.Document)
member.summary: Determines if the input document is valid, against the whitelist. It is considered valid if all the tags and attributes in the input HTML are allowed by the whitelist.
member.remarks: This method can be used as a validator for user input forms. An invalid document will still be cleaned successfully using the document. If using as a validator, it is recommended to still clean the document to ensure enforced attributes are set correctly, and that the output is tidied.
member.param: document to test
member.returns: true if no tags or attributes need to be removed; false if they do

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Cleaner.CopySafeNodes(JetyDu.HttpParse.Nodes.Element,JetyDu.HttpParse.Nodes.Element)
member.summary: Iterates the input and copies trusted nodes (tags, attributes, text) into the destination.
member.param: source of HTML
destination element to copy into
member.returns: number of discarded elements (that were considered unsafe)

member.name: P:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.None
member.summary: This whitelist allows only text nodes: all HTML will be stripped.

member.name: P:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.SimpleText
member.summary: This whitelist allows only simple text formatting: b, em, i, strong, u. All other HTML (tags and attributes) will be removed.

member.name: P:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.Basic
member.summary: This whitelist allows a fuller range of text nodes: a, b, blockquote, br, cite, code, dd, dl, dt, em, i, li, ol, p, pre, q, small, strike, strong, sub, sup, u, ul, and appropriate attributes.
member.remarks: Links (a elements) can point to http, https, ftp, mailto, and have an enforced rel=nofollow attribute. Does not allow images.

member.name: P:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.BasicWithImages
member.summary: This whitelist allows the same text tags as {@link #basic}, and also allows img tags, with appropriate attributes, with src pointing to http or https.

member.name: P:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.Relaxed
member.summary: This whitelist allows a full range of text and structural body HTML: a, b, blockquote, br, caption, cite, code, col, colgroup, dd, dl, dt, em, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, i, img, li, ol, p, pre, q, small, strike, strong, sub, sup, table, tbody, td, tfoot, th, thead, tr, u, ul
member.remarks: Links do not have an enforced rel=nofollow attribute, but you can add that if desired.

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new, empty whitelist. Generally it will be better to start with a default prepared whitelist instead.

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.AddTags(System.String[])
member.summary: Add a list of allowed elements to a whitelist. (If a tag is not allowed, it will be removed from the HTML.)
member.param: tag names to allow

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.AddAttributes(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Add a list of allowed attributes to a tag. (If an attribute is not allowed on an element, it will be removed.) E.g.: AddAttributes("a", "href", "class") allows href and class attributes on a tags.
member.remarks: To make an attribute valid for all tags, use the pseudo tag :all, e.g. AddAttributes(":all", "class").
member.param: The tag the attributes are for. The tag will be added to the allowed tag list if necessary.
List of valid attributes for the tag.

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.AddEnforcedAttribute(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add an enforced attribute to a tag. An enforced attribute will always be added to the element. If the element already has the attribute set, it will be overridden.
member.remarks: E.g.: AddEnforcedAttribute("a", "rel", "nofollow") will make all a tags output as <a href="..." rel="nofollow">
member.param: The tag the enforced attribute is for. The tag will be added to the allowed tag list if necessary.
The attribute key
The enforced attribute value

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.PreserveRelativeLinks(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Configure this Whitelist to preserve relative links in an element's URL attribute, or convert them to absolute links. By default, this is false: URLs will be made absolute (e.g. start with an allowed protocol, like e.g. "http://".
Note that when handling relative links, the input document must have an appropriate base URI set when parsing, so that the link's protocol can be confirmed. Regardless of the setting of the preserve relative links option, the link must be resolvable against the base URI to an allowed protocol; otherwise the attribute will be removed.
member.param: True to allow relative links, false (default) to deny

member.name: M:JetyDu.HttpParse.Safety.Whitelist.AddProtocols(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Add allowed URL protocols for an element's URL attribute. This restricts the possible values of the attribute to URLs with the defined protocol.
member.remarks: E.g.: AddProtocols("a", "href", "ftp", "http", "https")
member.param: Tag the URL protocol is for
Attribute key
List of valid protocols

member.name: T:JetyDu.HttpParse.Select.NodeVisitor
member.summary: Node visitor interface. Provide an implementing class to NodeTraversor to iterate through nodes. This interface provides two methods, Head() and Tail(). The head method is called when the node is first seen, and the tail method when all of the node's children have been visited. As an example, head can be used to create a start tag for a node, and tail to create the end tag.

the depth of the node, relative to the root node. E.g., the root node has depth 0, and a child node of that will have depth 1.
